_header: Of English kings here lieth the beauteous flower
Subjects: chronicles, verse in; Edward III, death of; epitaphs
_description: Epitaph for Edward III, translating four lines of Latin verse which precede it, in Part VII of Fabyan’s Chronicle, Septima Pars, Edwardi Tercii — one stanza rhyme royal

HarEng766.Transcription:
Of Englissh kinges here lyeth the bewtevous fflourOf alle before
                    passed And mirrour to them shall sueA mercyfull kyng of peace
                    conservatourThe thrid Edward the Deth of Whom maye RueAlle Inglisshe
                    men ffor he by knyghthood dueWas lybard Invict And by ffeate
                    marciallTo worthy machobe In vertue peregall
